indianRecipes.name: Butter Chicken
instructions: Marinate chicken with ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, and salt.
Heat butter in a pan, add onions, and sauté until golden brown.
Add tomato puree, garam masala, and cook until oil separates.
Add marinated chicken and cook until tender.
Stir in cream, simmer for a few minutes, and garnish with coriander leaves.

indianRecipes.name: Paneer Tikka
instructions: Mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, salt, and oil to make the marinade.
Marinate paneer cubes in the mixture for 30 minutes.
Thread paneer cubes onto skewers and grill until slightly charred.
Serve hot with mint chutney.

indianRecipes.name: Chicken Biryani
ingredients: A few saffron strands soaked in milk
Fresh mint and coriander leaves for garnish
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, and biryani masala.
In a separate pot, cook the rice until it's partially done.
In a large pan, heat ghee, add sliced onions, and cook until caramelized.
Layer the marinated chicken, rice, saffron milk, and chopped tomatoes in a pot.
Cook on low heat until the chicken is tender and the rice is fully cooked.
Garnish with fresh mint and coriander leaves before serving.

indianRecipes.name: Masala Dosa
instructions: Soak dosa rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds in water for 6 hours.
Grind the soaked mixture into a smooth batter and ferment for 8 hours.
Heat a griddle, pour a ladleful of batter, and spread it into a thin dosa.
Add potato masala filling, fold the dosa, and cook until crispy.
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

indianRecipes.name: Chana Masala
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft.
Stir in coriander powder, turmeric, garam masala, red chili powder, and salt.
Add cooked chickpeas and simmer until the curry thickens.
Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve with rice or naan.

indianRecipes.name: Aloo Paratha
instructions: Mix whole wheat flour, water, and a pinch of salt to make the dough for parathas.
In a separate bowl, combine mashed potatoes, chopped onions, green chilies, cumin seeds, turmeric, garam masala, and salt.
Divide the dough into small portions and roll each portion into a small circle.
Place a spoonful of potato mixture in the center, fold the dough, and roll it into a paratha.
Cook on a griddle with ghee until both sides are golden brown.
Serve hot with yogurt or pickles.
